alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:48PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Box Elder County through 730 PM MDT... At 647 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles west of Park Valley, or 31 miles southeast of Oakley Reservoir, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Park Valley, Etna, Standrod, Grouse Creek, Lynn, Rosette and Yost. This includes Utah Route 30 between mile markers 1 and 8, and between mile markers 31 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains
